tn.text: Parallelism is common in Hebrew poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
The psalmist is speaking to all of God's people, so you should use the plural command form if your language has one. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pronouns]])
Possible meanings are 1) "a song you have never sung before" or 2) a song no one has ever sung before.

tn.ref: rejoice in the one who made them
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "rejoice because he made them" or 2) "rejoice because the one who made them is good."
The words "their king" is likely a reference to God. Possible meanings are 1) "rejoice because he is their king" or 2) "rejoice because their king is good."
The word "name" is a metonym for Yahweh himself. AT: "praise him" or "tell people how great he is" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
a musical instrument with a head like a drum that can be hit and with pieces of metal around the side that sound when the instrument is shaken (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
"gives glory to the humble by saving them from their enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
"even even as they lie down to sleep at night" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: May the praises of God be in their mouths
tn.text: The mouth is a metonym for the whole person. AT: "May they always be ready to praise God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: a two-edged sword in their hand
tn.text: edged sword in their hand** - If swords are not known, use the name of a local weapon. The word "sword" is a metonym for being ready to fight in war. AT: "may they always be ready to go to war for him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The phrase "the nations" is a metonym for the people who live in the nations. AT: "the people of the nations" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
These are made of heavy metal and restrict the movement of prisoners.
a pair of chains or bands with a chain between that limits the movement of both a person's hands or feet.

tn.ref: execute the judgment that is written
tn.text: do what Yahweh had Moses write that people should do with those who are guilty (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
